notes.text:
Red Hat OpenShift Service Mesh 2.2.8

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Red Hat OpenShift Service Mesh is Red Hat's distribution of the Istio service mesh project, tailored for installation into an OpenShift Container Platform installation.

Security Fix(es):

* openshift: OCP & FIPS mode (CVE-2023-3089)

* net/http, golang.org/x/net/http2: avoid quadratic complexity in HPACK decoding (CVE-2022-41723)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: A flaw was found in golang. A maliciously crafted HTTP/2 stream could cause excessive CPU consumption in the HPACK decoder, sufficient to cause a denial of service from a small number of requests.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: golang.org/x/net/http2: avoid quadratic complexity in HPACK decoding
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Within OpenShift Container Platform, the maximum impact of this vulnerability is a denial of service against an individual container so the impact could not cascade across the entire infrastructure, this vulnerability is rated Moderate impact.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: golang.org/x/net/http2: avoid quadratic complexity in HPACK decoding

acknowledgments.summary: This issue was discovered by Red Hat.

cwe.name: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm

notes.text: A compliance problem was found in the Red Hat OpenShift Container Platform. Red Hat discovered that, when FIPS mode was enabled, not all of the cryptographic modules in use were FIPS-validated.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text:
https://access.redhat.com/security/vulnerabilities/RHSB-2023-001

The static scanning tool (to verify your system is once again compliant with FIPS) is available here https://github.com/openshift/check-payload
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258
Red Hat has investigated whether a possible mitigation exists for this issue, and has not been able to identify a practical example. Please update the affected packages as soon as possible.
